Title: AN ACT APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THE NECESSARY EXPENSE OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING DECEMBER THIRTY-FIRST, NINETEEN HUNDRED AND TWENTY-THREE AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

[ Act No. 3060, February 01, 1923 ]
AN ACT APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THE NECESSARY EXPENSE OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING DECEMBER THIRTY-FIRST, NINETEEN HUNDRED AND TWENTY-THREE AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in Legislature assembled and by the authority of the same:
Section 1. The following sums, or so much thereof as may be respectively necessary, are hereby appropriated, out of any funds in the Insular Treasury not appropriated for other purposes, in compensation of the service of the Philippine Government for the fiscal year ending December thirty-first, nineteen hundred and twenty-three, unless otherwise stated.
See Printed Copy Volume 18 Public Laws Page 4 to 137
Section 2. At the request of any Department head, the Emergency Board may authorize the transfer of any unexpended balance of the appropriations for "salaries and wages" to any item under "miscellaneous expenses" of the same Bureau or Office, if the interests of the public service so require it, any provision of existing law to the contrary notwithstanding.ℒαwρhi৷
Section 3. Any provision of existing law to the contrary notwithstanding, no person shall be employed under contract by the Insular Government unless this be authorized by an appropriation in this Act.
Section 4. This Act shall take effect on January first, nineteen hundred and twenty-three.
Approved, February 1, 1923.
